channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Most teens have used AI to flirt and chat â€” but still prefer human interaction
item.description: A new report from the group Common Sense Media shows teens are experimenting with AI "companions" designed to provide deep conversations and advice.
item.content:encoded: A new report from the group Common Sense Media shows teens are experimenting with AI "companions" designed to provide deep conversations and advice.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: "We are on our knees": U.S. tariffs devastate Lesotho's garment workers
item.description: The government of the tiny African kingdom of Lesotho has declared a two-year state of disaster, as its once-thriving garment industry unravels in the wake of Trump's tariffs threats.
item.content:encoded:
The government of the tiny African kingdom of Lesotho has declared a two-year state of disaster, as its once-thriving garment industry unravels in the wake of Trump's tariffs threats.

(Image credit: Per-Anders Pettersson)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Japan votes in a key election as Prime Minister Ishiba faces a possible loss
item.description: Soaring prices, lagging incomes and burdensome social security payments are the top issues for frustrated, cash-strapped voters. Stricter measures targeting foreign residents and visitors have also emerged as a key issue, with a surging right-wing populist party leading the campaign.
item.content:encoded:
Soaring prices, lagging incomes and burdensome social security payments are the top issues for frustrated, cash-strapped voters. Stricter measures targeting foreign residents and visitors have also emerged as a key issue, with a surging right-wing populist party leading the campaign.

(Image credit: Eugene Hoshiko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 3 people are still missing from deadly floods in Texas county, down from nearly 100
item.description: Officials in a Texas hill country community pummeled by deadly flooding July 4 said Saturday that just three people remain missing, down from nearly 100, after people who had previously been reported missing have since been accounted for.
item.content:encoded:
Officials in a Texas hill country community pummeled by deadly flooding July 4 said Saturday that just three people remain missing, down from nearly 100, after people who had previously been reported missing have since been accounted for.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Cuts to public media will smash budgets of some local radio stations
item.description: Congress voted to claw back federal funding to public media. Some of those hit hardest include community radio stations in areas that voted for the president.
item.content:encoded:
Congress voted to claw back federal funding to public media. Some of those hit hardest include community radio stations in areas that voted for the president.

(Image credit: Kristian Thacker for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: 32 Palestinians killed trying to reach food distribution hubs, Gaza authorities say
item.description: Palestinians were shot dead during a food distribution on Saturday at a center run by a U.S.- and Israeli-backed group in southern Gaza, hospital officials said.
item.content:encoded:
Palestinians were shot dead during a food distribution on Saturday at a center run by a U.S.- and Israeli-backed group in southern Gaza, hospital officials said.

(Image credit: Mariam Dagga)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Examining the role of men in the gender gap in American society
item.description: The latest season of the podcast "Unsettled" from Iowa Public Radio looks at how gender affects people's everyday lives.
item.content:encoded: The latest season of the podcast "Unsettled" from Iowa Public Radio looks at how gender affects people's everyday lives.

item.title: Police are investigating a man's death after he was pulled into MRI machine
item.description: New York police said the 61-year-old man was wearing a large metal chain that caused him to be "drawn into the machine." The FDA warns that MRI scan create a "strong, static magnetic field."
item.content:encoded:
New York police said the 61-year-old man was wearing a large metal chain that caused him to be "drawn into the machine." The FDA warns that MRI scan create a "strong, static magnetic field."

(Image credit: Keith Srakocic)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: A surprise twist in the Trump administration's use of third country deportations
item.description: Chris Camponovo, a former State Department lawyer, examines what a multi-national prisoner swap says about the Trump administration's third country deportation strategy.
item.content:encoded: Chris Camponovo, a former State Department lawyer, examines what a multi-national prisoner swap says about the Trump administration's third country deportation strategy.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: Reporting on family separation and aggressive immigration enforcement in Florida
item.description: Behind the scenes with NPR's reporting on how Florida has become the scene of some of the Trump administration's most aggressive immigration enforcement efforts.
item.content:encoded: Behind the scenes with NPR's reporting on how Florida has become the scene of some of the Trump administration's most aggressive immigration enforcement efforts.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow
